options: I wanted to reach out about career opportunities
I'm interested in your technical skills
Not sure how I got here...but sure why not
bio: I surround myself with people who are smarter than me to learn from them. I'm motivated and determined to always better myself, and I bring out the best in others because I know that brings out the best in me.
I'm entering into my junior year at Lehigh University, and am interested in internship opportunities in business and technology.

major.title: Computer Science
major.description: I plan on concentrating my MS in CS in the areas of data analytics and machine learning.

major.title: Computer Science & Business
major.description: The Computer Science & Business program is a special program at Lehigh that is both ABET and AACSB accredited, meaning it is a full computer science and full business degree. I learn everything a computer science student learns, everything a business major learns, and how these disciplines interact in the modern world.

courses.title: Programming and Data Structures
courses.description: Algorithmic design and implementation in a high level, object oriented language, such as Java. Classes, subclasses, recursion, searching, sorting, linked lists, trees, stacks, queues.

courses.title: Intro to Data Science
courses.description: Data Science is a fast-growing interdisciplinary field, focusing on the computational analysis of data to extract knowledge and insight. Collection, preparation, analysis, modeling, and visualization of data, covering both conceptual and practical issues. Examples from diverse fields and hands-on use of statistical and data manipulation software.

courses.title: Blockchain Algorithms
courses.description: Data Science is a fast-growing interdisciplinary field, focusing on the computational analysis of data to extract knowledge and insight. Collection, preparation, analysis, modeling, and visualization of data, covering both conceptual and practical issues. Examples from diverse fields and hands-on use of statistical and data manipulation software.

courses.title: Software Engineering
courses.description: The software lifecycle; lifecycle models; software planning; testing; specification methods; maintenance. Emphasis on team work and large-scale software systems, including oral presentations and written reports.

courses.title: Algorithms
courses.description: Algorithms for searching, sorting, manipulating graphs and trees, finding shortest paths and minimum spanning trees, scheduling tasks, etc.: proofs of their correctness and analysis of their asymptotic runtime and memory demands. Designing algorithms: recursion, divide-and-conquer, greediness, dynamic programming. Limits on algorithm efficiency using elementary NP-completeness theory.

courses.title: Database Systems, Algorithms, and Applications
courses.description: Design of large databases; normalization; query languages (including SQL); Transaction-processing protocols; Query optimization; performance tuning; distributed systems.

courses.title: Entrepreneurial Ventures Capstone - The Garage
courses.description: A special course in launching businesses

description.text: High Technology High School is a pre-engineering career academy that emphasizes the interconnections among mathematics, science, technology and the humanities, prepares students to become proactive and creative problem solvers, effective communicators, and tomorrow's leaders through a rigorous, specialized curriculum and collaborative partnerships.

bullets: Developed in Angular 7 on the next generation of the PI Visualization software, working on UI, data processing, and testing areas
Worked in an Agile - Scrum environment, including running stand-ups for a team of 9 and presenting at project-wide sprint review meetings
Completed an average of 15 Kanban-style effort points per sprint, improving the team's average velocity metric by 17%
Evaluated different enterprise blockchain and distributed ledger technology solutions for internal and external use for PwC Czech Republic’s Assurance department
Developed a plugin using VBA and Hyperledger Composer for Microsoft Excel that allows for workbooks to export to and import from a distributed Hyperledger Fabric network
Developed localization script for global logistical reporting using Python’s XML ElementTree
Detected and analyzed coding bugs and algorithmic efficiency in pre-existing programs

catalog.title: HTML5
catalog.description: Like many other programmers, HTML was one of the first technologies I was exposed to. I find it as a phenomenal entry point for learning computer science, as it's a straightforward, visual representation of the power of computers - and serves as the underlying foundation for the internet.

awards.title: Piazza Tech Tour Finalist
bullets: Selected as one of 10 Finalists for the Piazza Summer 2019 Tech Tour
Piazza is an online educational technology platform that is utilized by 50,000 professors in 2,000 schools in more than 90 different countries

awards.title: Lehigh CSB PwC Scholar
bullets: Awarded as one of two students to receive a $2,000 scholarship towards study abroad expenses
Worked for PwC Czech Republic in Prague, Czechia, researching and developing a proof-of-concept Microsoft Excel blockchain plug-in

awards.title: Tau Beta Pi Initiate
bullets: Initiated as part of Lehigh University's Spring 2019 initiate class
Tau Beta Pi is the oldest engineering honor society in the United States

awards.title: Rossin Junior Fellow
bullets: Selected as one of two students by the Department of Computer Science & Engineering to represent the Class of 2021 in the RJF Honor Society
I help represent the P.C. Rossin College of Engineering & Applied Sciences to prospective students through admissions events and admitted student days

awards.title: Winner, Blockchain Design Prompt, Lehigh Valley Hacks
bullets: Prototyped an easy-to-use, fully functional virtual wallet device that allows transfer between ERC20 cryptocurrencies
Designed the User Interface to balance usability with data privacy via anonymous, but recognizable, user icons

awards.title: First Place, Wharton Undergraduate FinTech Hackathon
bullets: Prototyped a money-management solution aimed at consumers for easy-to-use peer-to-peer lending
Designed the User Interface to allow users for easy access to both peer users and their consumer bank
